definition[0]: a substance used to fill cracks in wood, walls etc, especially before you paint them
definition[1]: stories, information, pictures etc that are not important but are used to fill a page in a newspaper or magazine
definition[2]: a substance that is put under a personâ€™s skin to make lines on their skin less deep or to make their lips bigger
definition[3]: a short newspaper article or programme on television or radio, used to take up extra space or time, and to keep people interested
example[0]: He produced a series of short fillers for television.
